comprehensive_types.definition: General nouns referring to any person, place, thing, or idea (not specific names)
key_characteristics: Refers to any item in a category
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Daily communication - identifying and talking about everyday objects and concepts

comprehensive_types.definition: Specific names of particular people, places, organizations, or things
key_characteristics: Include names of days, months, holidays
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Identifying specific people, places, brands, and named entities

comprehensive_types.definition: Nouns that refer to things you can perceive through your senses (see, touch, hear, smell, taste)
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Describing physical objects and sensory experiences in writing and speech

comprehensive_types.definition: Nouns representing ideas, emotions, concepts, or qualities that cannot be physically perceived
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Discussing emotions, philosophies, virtues, and abstract concepts in communication

comprehensive_types.definition: Nouns that can be counted individually and have both singular and plural forms
comprehensive_types.example: apple ‚Üí apples, book ‚Üí books, student ‚Üí students
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Quantifying objects and items in measurements, prices, and inventory

comprehensive_types.definition: Nouns that cannot be counted individually and typically stay in singular form
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Referring to substances, abstract concepts, and mass nouns that don't have discrete units

comprehensive_types.definition: Singular nouns that refer to a group or collection of individual items or people
key_characteristics: Can take singular or plural verbs depending on context
Common in both formal and informal English
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Discussing groups, teams, organizations, and collections as unified entities

comprehensive_types.definition: Nouns made up of two or more words that function as a single unit with a specific meaning
comprehensive_types.example: toothbrush, mother-in-law, ice cream, school bus, social media
key_characteristics: Written as one word, hyphenated, or two words
comprehensive_types.real_world_use: Creating precise terms for complex concepts and modern inventions in everyday language

comprehensive_learning_structure.description: Each noun type includes all of the following comprehensive materials

sections.description: 3 detailed paragraphs explaining the concept thoroughly with context
5 step-by-step breakdown of how the noun type is formed and used
10+ examples with translations, breakdown, context, and difficulty levels
5 essential grammar rules specific to this noun type
8 common mistakes with corrections and explanations
Guided creative writing task with sample answers and evaluation criteria
1-2 passages with highlighted examples and comprehension questions
Pronunciation for key words including IPA and audio tips
PDF and DOCX versions of the complete guide

interactive_learning: Interactive practice questions with immediate feedback

implementation_timeline.phase_1: Create 2 noun types with full content (2-3 days)
implementation_timeline.phase_3: Database seeding and API integration (2-3 days)
